channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: Hong Kong customs shuts down 2 online stores selling fake luxury goods worth HK$920,000; 2 arrested
item.description: Customs officers arrest two people, with consumers warned fake cosmetic products and perfumes could pose health and safety risks.

item.title: Hundreds of campuses in Indonesia inspired by global student protests to renew rallies against Israel
item.description: It was the latest demonstration of the country’s strong support for Palestinians, which has also driven a boycott movement that has taken a toll on targeted businesses.

item.title: City of Plum Blossom: how a stone fortress in China survived 500 years of war with Japanese invaders
item.description: Scientists are studying China’s Meihua Fortress to see how it managed to withstand repeated attacks over centuries.

item.title: Hong Kong works on an ETF of HKEX stocks for Tadawul exchange in push for collaboration with Saudi Arabia
item.description: The new financial product underscores the flurry of collaborations and accords between Hong Kong and Riyadh since the February 2023 visit by Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu to the kingdom.

item.title: Watch: Russia marks Victory Day, emboldened by Ukraine war gains
item.description: The May 9 parade marks the Soviet Union’s defeat of Nazi Germany in World War II and has become one of Russia’s most important public holidays.

item.title: Why China’s diversified economy garners both praise and criticism
item.description: China has achieved economic success not just through repurposing Western technology but by rapidly upgrading and adapting it. Top-down management coexists with local autonomy and bottom-up innovation in the Chinese industrial ecosystem.
item.dc:creator: Prof Zhang Jun
item.author: Prof Zhang Jun

item.title: Hong Kong’s Greater Bay Airlines will suspend flights to Singapore next month, announcing cuts 2 weeks after service launched
item.description: Carrier announces cuts just two weeks after launching service to city state, citing commercial considerations.
item.dc:creator: Olga Wong,Cannix Yau
item.author: Olga Wong,Cannix Yau

item.title: QuantaSing, China’s Leading Adult Learning Platform, Extends Global Reach
item.description: Serving the Silver Economy According to the Asian Development Bank, the population of older individuals (over 60) in the region is expected to triple between 2010 and 2050, reaching close to 1.3 billion people. While the challenges posed by an aging population are often associated with socioeconomic issues in East Asia, there’s a positive trend emerging: the concept of the ‘Silver Economy.’ This term represents the development of products and services specifically tailored for the elderly. Even the younger cohort born in the 1960s and 1970s whom will soon be exploring retirement options are driving the growth of this economy through their unique consumption styles and capabilities. Being well-educated and with ample disposable income, they highly value self-fulfillment and achievement. Consequently, this new economic strata has significantly untapped potential and is positioned for even more growth. Quantasing is at the forefront of the Silver Economy, pioneering services in interest learning and life-long learning, seeking to meet market demand and improve lives at a time of transition that can be somewhat disruptive for many people. Since establishing in July 2019, the company has gained over 112 million registered users, making it the largest online adult learning platform in China. Innovative Engagement QuantaSing provides a wide variety of teaching courses delivered through livestreaming, community engagement, and a combination of online and offline (OMO) methods. By integrating advanced technologies like artificial intelligence (AI) into online learning, the company provides personalized services for the silver generation. QuantaSing’s teaching model seamlessly blends education and entertainment, making learning enjoyable. It also creates a sense of belonging and participation through social interactions, enhancing participant’s self-worth, happiness, and sense of achievement. Additionally, focused on consumer demand, QuantaSing continues to explore and develop products and…
item.dc:creator: Advertising partner
item.author: Advertising partner

item.title: Chinese woman charged with murder of man at Singapore condominium
item.description: Li Ye, a Chinese national, is accused of causing the death of Lim Lai Guan at a residential unit along Beach Road in the city state.

item.title: Germany rattled by violent attacks on politicians ahead of European elections
item.description: Further attacks on politicians in Germany have rattled the country and prompted renewed outrage from leaders, after Berlin’s former mayor was assaulted in a library.

item.title: Cathay Pacific’s HK Express rolls out cheap seats to beat regional rivals. But will low-cost fares to Japan, Taiwan lure budget travellers?

item.title: South Korea’s Yoon apologises over wife’s Dior handbag, vows to improve livelihoods
item.description: In his first news conference in about two years, Yoon Suk-yeol pledged to tame inflation and create a new ministry to boost the country’s birth rate.

item.title: Hong Kong steps up border, transport measures as Taiwanese band Mayday plays last show after rain, equipment fire forced postponement

item.title: Mainland China air, sea forces monitor USS Halsey’s Taiwan Strait transit

item.title: Russia builds surveillance bases near northern Japan. Is it ‘punishing’ Tokyo for supporting Ukraine?
item.description: Russia’s new development on the Kuril Islands aims to ‘punish’ Japan for supporting international sanctions and providing aid to Ukraine, analysts say.

item.title: South Korean DJ NewJeansNim faces calls for ban in Malaysia after performing in monk robe at dance club

item.title: China trade: ‘resilient’ April exports beat expectations on tailwinds of global recovery
item.description: China’s exports rose by 1.5 per cent from a year earlier to US$292.5 billion in April, while imports rose by 8.4 per cent year on year last month, data released on Thursday showed.

item.title: Nicaragua cancels controversial Chinese canal concession after nearly a decade
item.description: Nicaragua’s congress, controlled by President Daniel Ortega, repealed a law which had given a Chinese investor a concession of up to 100 years to build and operate a canal between the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans

item.title: Scratching your head over July 28 disruption on Hong Kong’s busy Kwun Tong MTR line? The Post is here to help you navigate

item.title: Why organisations invest in branded content – and how to find the winning formula
item.description: Industry leaders and influencers gather to share their insights on the power of branded content at a breakfast event titled “Embracing #Ad”. The event challenged the audience to think about what it means to deploy a successful branded content campaign and how marketers can maximise their returns.

item.title: Tech war: China’s use of RISC-V chip standard faces headwinds amid US scrutiny and Google’s end of Android support

item.title: Charging for waste: Hong Kong needs action, not more procrastination

item.title: Critics, opposition slam India’s election body for bias towards Modi’s ruling BJP: ‘extremely compromised’

item.title: China’s banks pore over Russia transactions, causing delays and unsettling exporters
